page.title: 16Port Quin
page.content: Port Quin is a small quiet bay on the north Cornish coast in the middle of the countryside.It has a cliff walk which leads from Port Quin to Port Isaac which goes right on the edge of the cliff and has lots of steps.Doyden Point is on the other side of Port Quin bay.It is a sort of mound with a path all round it.In the middle of it there is a folly which belongs to the National Trust.In 1978 a ship was wrecked off Doyden Point where it stayed for several years until broken up for scrap.Years ago they used to bring pilchards from the sea into the fish cellars which are now private holiday cottages.The bay itself is safe for swimming but there are rocks and quite a lot of seaweed.I think that Port Quin is a very nice quiet place.
